page.title: 10THE MALT KILN. SCALES.
page.content: The Maltkiln in Scales is thought to be 200-300 years old.It plays a very important part in the village life. It is used for the following: Church Council meetings 6 times a year P.C.C. meetings, 3times ayear. W.I. meetings 2 times a month. Roller Disco every Thursday 6pm-7pm. Annual School Dance each November. Annual School Concert each December. Annual Farmers Ball each November. Art and Craft Exhibitions. Coffee Evenings and Coffee Mornings. Play School 2 afternoons per week. It is hoped that the local school is going to use it for P.E. commencing with the Autumn Term in September,1985 The rental charge is: Small room Â£1 per hour. Large room Â£2.50 per hour without heating, Â£4.00 per hour with heating. Rent is paid to the church who own the building.
